intro: Coleonema aspalathoides, commonly known as the yellow-flowered plectranthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
